    • Method Detail

      • generateAllOutputFileNames

        public static java.lang.String[] generateAllOutputFileNames(java.lang.StringBuilder outputFilePrefix,
                                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allOutputFilesSuffixes)
         This Method generates all the output file names from the given prfix and set of suffixes.

 For each suffix in the set, suffix is appended to the prefix and added in to the output array.
 ie.  outputFilePrefix = "myoutput_4_"
 allOutputFilesSuffixes  = { 1,2,3,4 }  This is generated with the help of getOutputNumbersSet
 then,
 output array will contain elements like below
 [ "myoutput_4_1", "myoutput_4_2", "myoutput_4_3", "myoutput_4_4" ]

 what output file name signifies ?
 In "myoutput_4_1"
 myoutput  = actual Input file name, that we want to retain for mergeing purpose.
 _         = separator. can be configured
 4         = excess number of bytes
 1         = part Number ( or say file number)
        Parameters:
        outputFilePrefix - prefix of the output file name.
        allOutputFilesSuffixes - set of Strings which are part numbers. ( Note that it is Set of Strings)
        Returns:
        String[] containing all the output file names.

      • generateAllOutputFileNumbers

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> generateAllOutputFileNumbers(int NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES)
         This method generates set of strings from 1 to NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES.
 ie.  If  NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES = 4 , then  this method returns = {"1","2","3","4"}
        Parameters:
        NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES - int value specifying how many output files we want
        Returns:
        set of all suffixes required for output files.

      • getEachPartSizeFromFilename

        public static long getEachPartSizeFromFilename(java.lang.String outputFileName,
                                               long extraBytesSize)
         return the partSize from any of the output file produced by Solution.produce(String) method.
        Parameters:
        outputFileName - filename
        extraBytesSize - number of extra bytes at the end of the ouput file produced by Solution.produce(String) method.
        Returns:
        number of bytes in each part of the file.

      • getEachPartSizeFromFileSize

        public static long getEachPartSizeFromFileSize(long inputFileSize)
         returns the number of bytes in each part.

 ie.  If  inputFileSize = 35 bytes and @SolutionConfig.NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES = 3, then it returns 11.
 Because Input file can be divided in 3 Parts each of size 11.
        Parameters:
        inputFileSize - input file size in long
        Returns:
        number of bytes in each part in long

        Returns:

                                                              long extraBytesSize)
         retrieve prefix for output file. It returns StringBuilder to achieve improved performance.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - input file
        extraBytesSize - or modulo bytes returned by getRemainderPartSizeFromFileSize(long)
        Returns:

      • getRemainderPartSizeFromFilename

 Solution.produce(String) method
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        number of remaining bytes in the output file Solution.produce(String) method.

      • getRemainderPartSizeFromFileSize

        public static long getRemainderPartSizeFromFileSize(long inputFileSize)
         returns the number of bytes in each part.

 ie.  If  inputFileSize = 35 bytes and SolutionConfig.NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES = 3, then it returns 3.
 Because Input file can be divided in 3 Parts each of size 11. and last 2 bytes will be remaining.
        Parameters:
        inputFileSize - input file size in long
        Returns:
        number of remaining(modulo) bytes in long

      • readAndWriteSubPart

        public static void readAndWriteSubPart(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                                       java.lang.StringBuilder outputFilePrefix,
                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allOutputFilesSuffixes,
                                       long startByteToRead,
                                       long bytesToRead)
                                throws java.io.IOException
         For Given inputFileName, this method reads bytes starting from startByteToRead till  (
 startByteToRead +  bytesToRead) ( including start, excluding last ) and writes in to all the output
 files. Output file names are generated by appending suffixes from the set to the prefix.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - input filename from which byte needs to be read
        outputFilePrefix - prefix of outputfilename where byte needs to be written
        allOutputFilesSuffixes - set of suffixes of outputfilenames which in conjuction with prefix generate filename in whcih bytes needs to be written
        startByteToRead - offset for inputfile from where bytes needs to be read
        bytesToRead - how many bytes to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to open/close/read/write input or output file.

      • validateFileNameConventions

        public static boolean validateFileNameConventions(java.lang.String filename1,
                                                  java.lang.String filename2)
         compares whether given two input file follows naming conventions or not.
        Parameters:
        filename1 - first input file to Solution.combine(String, String) function.
        filename2 - second input file to Solution.combine(String, String) function.
        Returns:
        true if both input files are valid, else false

      • writeByteChunkToAllOutputFiles

        public static void writeByteChunkToAllOutputFiles(java.lang.StringBuilder outputFilePrefix,
                                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> outputFileNumbers,
                                                  byte[] byteChunk)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
         This method writes the given byte array in to all respective output files.
 ie.  outputFilePrefix = "myoutput_"
 outputFileNumbers = { 1,2,3,4}
 then, this method will write given byteChunk in to all separate files called
 myoutput_1, myoutput_2 , myoutput_3 and myoutput_4
 To Improve performance, StringBuilder is being used.
 To Use faster naming conventions, we are using HashSet.
        Parameters:
        outputFilePrefix - Prefix of the output files' name.
        outputFileNumbers - set of numbers that create suffixes from 1 to NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES ( including both )
        byteChunk - byte array that needs to be written in file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read/write/open/close input or output file.
